meanings.definition: The part of a plant that grows underground, producing roots and shoots.
meanings.sent1: The farmer dug up the rootstalks to inspect the health of the plant.
meanings.sent2: The rootstalks of the tree spread far and wide, anchoring it securely in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit thought the rootstalks were tunnels leading to hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The network of rootstalks connected the plants like a secret underground communication system.
meanings.sent5: In the darkness of the soil, the rootstalks worked tirelessly to support the plant above.

meanings.definition: A horizontal stem that produces roots below and shoots above.
meanings.sent1: The gardener carefully trimmed the rootstalks to encourage new growth.
meanings.sent2: The rootstalks of the strawberry plant spread out, creating a dense mat.
meanings.sent3: The rootstalks seemed to be playing a game of hide-and-seek with the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The rootstalks intertwined like dancers in a graceful ballet, supporting each other.
meanings.sent5: The rootstalks emerged from the soil like explorers venturing into a new world.
